intro: Freycinetia imbricata var. hispidula, commonly known as the woolly freycinetia, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is a member of the palms family (Arecaceae) and is characterized by its distinctive, hairy fronds. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils and salty air. Its inflorescences produce small, fragrant flowers that are visited by various pollinators. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphological features and ecological significance.
